main event: A civilian in Monroe, Michigan reported a sighting of a flying disk-like object travelling among naval aircraft on 21 June 1949. The object was disc-like with a heavy center section, traveled southwest, and disappeared within two seconds. It left a vapor disturbance as it traveled.
interesting points: The object was observed among several naval aircraft, indicating that it was within a controlled airspace.
The report was corroborated by a reporter from the Monroe Evening News, adding to its credibility.
The object's disc-like shape and sudden disappearance within two seconds are unusual and not easily explained.
The presence of a vapor disturbance as the object traveled suggests physical evidence of its passing.
The report was forwarded to the Chief of Naval Operations, indicating the seriousness with which it was treated.
witnesses: Civilian and reporter on the Monroe Evening News
